component.name: Select
component.description: Allow the user to choose a single value from a known, finite list of options.

useCases: User can recognize the correct option without searching
Only one option may be selected

commonPatterns.name: basic-select
commonPatterns.composition:
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger>
    <SelectValue placeholder="Choose an option" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="a">Option A</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="b">Option B</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>

commonPatterns.name: grouped-select
commonPatterns.description: Options organized into labeled groups with separators

commonPatterns.name: inline-select
commonPatterns.description: Borderless inline trigger for tab-like or embedded selection contexts

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Select when options are numerous or unbounded
antiPatterns.reason: Select has no search/filter capability; long lists are hard to scan
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Combobox for large or dynamic option sets

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Select when user needs to search or filter
antiPatterns.reason: Select does not support typing to filter options

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Select when options are dynamic or object-based
antiPatterns.reason: Select works best with static, string-based value lists

slots.select: Root provider â€” manages open/close state and value
slots.select-trigger: The clickable button that opens the dropdown; accepts size prop
slots.select-value: Displays the selected value or placeholder inside the trigger
slots.select-content: Popover dropdown that contains the option list
slots.select-group: Groups related options under a label
slots.select-label: Non-interactive label for a group of options
slots.select-item-indicator: Checkmark shown on the selected item
slots.select-separator: Visual divider between groups or items
slots.select-scroll-up-button: Scroll affordance at the top of overflow content
slots.select-scroll-down-button: Scroll affordance at the bottom of overflow content

parentConstraints: SelectTrigger and SelectContent must be direct children of Select

interactions.select: Clicking or pressing Enter on an item selects it and closes the dropdown
interactions.keyboard: Arrow keys navigate items; Enter/Space selects; Escape closes
interactions.focus: Visible 2px focus ring on trigger; items highlight on focus

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Arrow keys to navigate options; Enter/Space to select; Escape to close; Tab to move focus away
accessibility.screenReader: Announces trigger label, selected value, expanded/collapsed state, and option labels
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus moves into dropdown on open; returns to trigger on close

rules: Selection is made from a closed list
User does not type to filter options
Only one value may be selected
Prefer Select over Combobox when options are short and recognizable

aiHints.context: Prefer Select over Combobox when options are short, recognizable, and do not require search. Do not use Select as a searchable control. If users must type to filter, use Combobox. For 2-5 visible options where comparison matters, consider RadioGroup.
